publicwhip.spmotion: S2M-3399 Margaret Jamieson (Kilmarnock and Loudoun) (Lab): That the Parliament condemns the comments of Sir John Ward, Chairman of Scottish Enterprise, at a briefing of MSPs on Wednesday 5 October 2005 when he stated that the economy of Ayrshire was like that of an Eastern European country, and calls on the current Minister for Enterprise and Lifelong Learning to direct Scottish Enterprise and Sir John Ward to undertake the commitments given by Jim Wallace, the then Minister for Enterprise and Lifelong Learning, to improve the economy of Ayrshire. Supported by: Alex Neil*, Mark Ballard*

S2M-3399 Margaret Jamieson: Condemnation of Sir John Wardâ€”That the Parliament condemns the comments of Sir John Ward, Chairman of Scottish Enterprise, at a briefing of MSPs on Wednesday 5 October 2005 when he stated that the economy of Ayrshire was like that of an Eastern European country and calls on the current Minister for Enterprise and Lifelong Learning to direct Scottish Enterprise and Sir John Ward to undertake the commitments given by Jim Wallace, the then Minister for Enterprise and Lifelong Learning, to improve the economy of Ayrshire. Supported by: Alex Neil, Mark Ballard, Irene Oldfather*
S2M-3399 Condemnation of Sir John Ward (lodged on 5 October 2005) Bill Butler*, Mr Adam Ingram*
